Husayn said: Narrated to us Abu Qudamah, he said: Narrated to us 'Abd al-Rahman, he said: Narrated to us Jabir ibn Yazid, from Hassan ibn Mukhariq Abu al-'Awwam. Narrated to us 'Ubadah, he said: Narrated to us 'Abd al-Samad, he said: Narrated to us Harb ibn Shaddad, from Husayn, from Hassan ibn Abi al-Mukhariq, from Abu 'Abdillah.

hadiths.english_translation: Damrah said: From Ibn Shawdhab: and he was among the merchants of the people of Basra - Ayyub wrote to Hassan - so I came to him and the merchants were around him doing business. Damrah said: Hassan said: 'How easy is scrupulousness! If something makes you doubtful in your soul, leave it.'

narrators.name: Hassan
narrators.full_name: Hassan (identity not clearly specified - possibly Hassan al-Basri or Hassan ibn Wabrah)

narrators.name: Ayyub
narrators.full_name: Ayyub (identity not specified - possibly Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani)

chainIssues: Fragment - biographical anecdote rather than hadith transmission

Hassan's identity is ambiguous (could be Hassan al-Basri or other Hassan)
Ayyub's identity is not specified
The matn contains a statement attributed to Hassan about scrupulousness
This appears to be a mawquf (stopped at Companion level) statement rather than marfu'
The anecdotal nature suggests this is from a biographical/historical commentary
Unknown source (Book 140)
